DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response used to determine the position on a scale of intensity of a well differentiated tumor with neuroendocrine differentiation that arises from the pancreas.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A low or intermediate grade well differentiated tumor with neuroendocrine differentiation that arises from the pancreas.  According to the presence or absence of clinical syndromes that result from hormone hypersecretion, pancreatic neuroendocrine tumors are classified either as functional or nonfunctional._The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs.  In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A low or intermediate grade well differentiated tumor with neuroendocrine differentiation that arises from the pancreas

Concepts.definition: A well differentiated, low, intermediate, or high grade neoplasm with neuroendocrine differentiation that arises from the pancreas.  According to the presence or absence of clinical syndromes that result from hormone hypersecretion, pancreatic neuroendocrine tumors are classified either as functional or nonfunctional.

Property.preferredDefinition: The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs.  In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains.

Concepts.definition: The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs.  In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Used to describe tumor samples that exhibit poorly differentiated or undifferentiated cells. They are generally expected to be fast growing and aggressive.

Concepts.definition: Used to describe tumor samples that exhibit poorly differentiated or undifferentiated cells. They are generally expected to be fast growing and aggressive.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A term referring to the degree of differentiation of a malignant neoplasm and indicating that it is moderately differentiated.

Concepts.definition: A term referring to the degree of differentiation of a malignant neoplasm and indicating that it is moderately differentiated.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Used to describe tumor samples that exhibit well to moderately well differentiated cells. They are generally expected to be slow growing and less aggressive.

Concepts.definition: Used to describe tumor samples that exhibit well to moderately well differentiated cells. They are generally expected to be slow growing and less aggressive.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality.

Concepts.definition: A position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality.

ValueDomain.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form

DataElement.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form
